{"step_by_step_thinking": "The ANB angle is a cephalometric measurement used to assess the anteroposterior relationship between the maxilla and the mandible. A negative ANB angle indicates that the mandible is positioned anteriorly relative to the maxilla, which is a characteristic of Class III malocclusion. The facial angle of 98° is within the normal range (88°-100°), indicating a normal relationship between the cranial base and the maxilla. Therefore, the case is likely of a True Class III malocclusion.", "answer_choice": "C. True Class III malocclusion"}
